729436f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729436f-a.text:
(1)
Richmomd Terrace, east from a point about 400
feet west of Holland Avenue -- from near the pond on the
Downey Shipbuilding Corporation's property.
September 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the north side of Richmond Terrace.
September 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
729436f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Holland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729434f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729434f-b.text:
(1)
Richmond Terrace, south side, between Holland and Linfield
Avenues, within the grounds of the Downey Shipbuilding Corporation,
showing the Post House. During the Revoluation Hessian officers
used it as their headquarters. For additional data see "Legends,
Stories and Folklore of Old Staten Island" by C. G. Hine and
W. T. Davia, p. 121.
June 4, 1922
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, at a later date.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additional view, at a still later date.
September 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
729434f-b.folder: Richmond Terrace & Holland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729435f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729435f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, south side, between Holland and Linfield
Avenues, showing the Post House, erected in 1691. The house stands
within the grounds of the Downey Shipbuilding Corporation, about
400 yards west of Holland Avenue.
About 1900
By C. A. Ingalls
From Staten Ialand Museum Collection throug P. L. Sperr
729435f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Holland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729437f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729437f-a.text:
(1)
Richmond Terrace (extreme left), south side, about 300 yards
west of Holland Avenue, showing the pond on the Downey Shipbuilding
Corporation grounds. The view is southeastward and shows workers'
dwellings strung along Holland Avenue.
April 15, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view in the same general direction, but looking
slightly more eastward. Richmond Terrace is on the left, with
telephone poles thereon.
October 10, 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
729437f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Holland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729517f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729517f-a.text:
(1)
3373 Richmond Terrace, north side, slightly east
of Holland Avenue, showing the DeBart House, formerly the
dwelling of Uncle John DeHart. It is said to be over 200
years old. See "Legend, Stories and Folklore of Old Staten
Tsland" by Hine and Davis, p. 119.
March 9, 1913
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, at a later date. Note that windows were
cut out on the second floor.
September 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additonal view, looking eastward.
'eptember 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
729517f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Holland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729518f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Holland Avenue
729518f-a.text:
3493 Richmond Terrace, north side, west of Holland Avenue,
showing the plant of the Fernic Airoraft Corporation.
September 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
